63uid_t real_uid, eff_uid;

65
66extern char *__progname;
67
68static int smblib_initialized;
69
70struct rcfile *smb_rc;
71
72int
73smb_lib_init(void)
74{
75 int error;
76#if __FreeBSD_version > 400000
77 int kv;
78 size_t kvlen = sizeof(kv);
79#endif
80
81 if (smblib_initialized)
82 return 0;
83#if __FreeBSD_version > 400000
84 error = sysctlbyname("net.smb.version", &kv, &kvlen, NULL, 0);
85 if (error) {
86 warnx("%s: can't find kernel module\n", __FUNCTION__);
87 return error;
88 }
89 if (NSMB_VERSION != kv) {
90 warnx("%s: kernel module version(%d) don't match library(%d).\n", __FUNCTION__, kv, NSMB_VERSION);
91 return EINVAL;
92 }
93#endif
94 if ((error = nls_setlocale("")) != 0) {
95 warnx("%s: can't initialise locale\n", __func__);
96 return error;
97 }
98 smblib_initialized++;
99 return 0;
100}
101
102/*
103 * Print a (descriptive) error message
104 * error values:
105 * 0 - no specific error code available;
106 * 1..32767 - system error
107 */
108void
109smb_error(const char *fmt, int error,...) {
110 va_list ap;
111 const char *cp;
112 int errtype = error & SMB_ERRTYPE_MASK;
113
114 fprintf(stderr, "%s: ", __progname);
115 va_start(ap, error);
116 vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
117 va_end(ap);
118 if (error == -1)
119 error = errno;
120 else
121 error &= ~SMB_ERRTYPE_MASK;
122 switch (errtype) {
123 case SMB_SYS_ERROR:
124 if (error)
125 fprintf(stderr, ": syserr = %s\n", strerror(error));
126 else
127 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
128 break;
129 case SMB_RAP_ERROR:
130 fprintf(stderr, ": raperr = %d (0x%04x)\n", error, error);
131 break;
132 case SMB_NB_ERROR:
133 cp = nb_strerror(error);
134 if (cp == NULL)
135 fprintf(stderr, ": nberr = unknown (0x%04x)\n", error);
136 else
137 fprintf(stderr, ": nberr = %s\n", cp);
138 break;
139 default:
140 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
141 }
142}
143
144char *
145smb_printb(char *dest, int flags, const struct smb_bitname *bnp) {
146 int first = 1;
147
148 strcpy(dest, "<");
149 for(; bnp->bn_bit; bnp++) {
150 if (flags & bnp->bn_bit) {
151 strcat(dest, bnp->bn_name);
152 first = 0;
153 }
154 if (!first && (flags & bnp[1].bn_bit))
155 strcat(dest, "|");
156 }
157 strcat(dest, ">");
158 return dest;
159}
160
161/*
162 * first read ~/.smbrc, next try to merge SMB_CFG_FILE
163 */
164int
165smb_open_rcfile(void)
166{
167 char *home;
168
169 home = getenv("HOME");
170 if (home) {
171 char fn[1024];
172 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "%s/.nsmbrc", home);
173 (void)rc_open(fn, "r", &smb_rc);
174 }
175 (void)rc_merge(SMB_CFG_FILE, &smb_rc);
176 if (smb_rc == NULL)
177 return ENOENT;
178 return 0;
179}
180
181void *
182smb_dumptree(void)
183{
184#ifdef __NetBSD__
185 /* XXX not supported on NetBSD */
186 return NULL;
187#else
188 size_t len;
189 void *p;
190 int error;
191
192#ifdef APPLE
193 seteuid(eff_uid); /* restore setuid root briefly */
194#endif
195 error = sysctlbyname("net.smb.treedump", NULL, &len, NULL, 0);
196#ifdef APPLE
197 seteuid(real_uid); /* and back to real user */
198#endif
199 if (error)
200 return NULL;
201 p = malloc(len);
202 if (p == NULL)
203 return NULL;
204#ifdef APPLE
205 seteuid(eff_uid); /* restore setuid root briefly */
206#endif
207 error = sysctlbyname("net.smb.treedump", p, &len, NULL, 0);
208#ifdef APPLE
209 seteuid(real_uid); /* and back to real user */
210#endif
211 if (error) {
212 free(p);
213 return NULL;
214 }
215 return p;
216#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
217}
218
219char *
220smb_simplecrypt(char *dst, const char *src)
221{
222 int ch, pos;
223 char *dp;
224
225 if (dst == NULL) {
226 dst = malloc(4 + 2 * strlen(src));
227 if (dst == NULL)
228 return NULL;
229 }
230 dp = dst;
231 *dst++ = '$';
232 *dst++ = '$';
233 *dst++ = '1';
234 pos = 27;
235 while (*src) {
236 ch = *src++;
237 if (isascii(ch))
238 ch = (isupper(ch) ? ('A' + (ch - 'A' + 13) % 26) :
239 islower(ch) ? ('a' + (ch - 'a' + 13) % 26) : ch);
240 ch ^= pos;
241 pos += 13;
242 sprintf(dst, "%02x", ch);
243 dst += 2;
244 }
245 *dst = 0;
246 return dp;
247}
248
249int
250smb_simpledecrypt(char *dst, const char *src)
251{
252 char *ep, hexval[3];
253 int len, ch, pos;
254
255 if (strncmp(src, "$$1", 3) != 0)
256 return EINVAL;
257 src += 3;
258 len = strlen(src);
259 if (len & 1)
260 return EINVAL;
261 len /= 2;
262 hexval[2] = 0;
263 pos = 27;
264 while (len--) {
265 hexval[0] = *src++;
266 hexval[1] = *src++;
267 ch = strtoul(hexval, &ep, 16);
268 if (*ep != 0)
269 return EINVAL;
270 ch ^= pos;
271 pos += 13;
272 if (isascii(ch))
273 ch = (isupper(ch) ? ('A' + (ch - 'A' + 13) % 26) :
274 islower(ch) ? ('a' + (ch - 'a' + 13) % 26) : ch);
275 *dst++ = ch;
276 }
277 *dst = 0;
278 return 0;
279}
280
281
282#ifdef APPLE
283static int
284safe_execv(char *args[])
285{
286 int pid;
287 union wait status;
288
289 pid = fork();
290 if (pid == 0) {
291 (void)execv(args[0], args);
292 errx(EX_OSERR, "%s: execv %s failed, %s\n", __progname,
293 args[0], strerror(errno));
294 }
295 if (pid == -1) {
296 fprintf(stderr, "%s: fork failed, %s\n", __progname,
297 strerror(errno));
298 return (1);
299 }
300 if (wait4(pid, (int *)&status, 0, NULL) != pid) {
301 fprintf(stderr, "%s: BUG executing %s command\n", __progname,
302 args[0]);
303 return (1);
304 } else if (!WIFEXITED(status)) {
305 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s command aborted by signal %d\n",
306 __progname, args[0], WTERMSIG(status));
307 return (1);
308 } else if (WEXITSTATUS(status)) {
309 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s command failed, exit status %d: %s\n",
310 __progname, args[0], WEXITSTATUS(status),
311 strerror(WEXITSTATUS(status)));
312 return (1);
313 }
314 return (0);
315}
316
317
318void
319dropsuid()
320{
321 /* drop setuid root privs asap */
322 eff_uid = geteuid();
323 real_uid = getuid();
324 seteuid(real_uid);
325 return;
326}
327
328
329static int
330kextisloaded(char * kextname)
331{
332 mach_port_t kernel_port;
333 kmod_info_t *k, *loaded_modules = 0;
334 int err, loaded_count = 0;
335
336 /* on error return not loaded - to make loadsmbvfs fail */
337
338 err = task_for_pid(mach_task_self(), 0, &kernel_port);
339 if (err) {
340 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: %s\n", __progname,
341 "unable to get kernel task port",
342 mach_error_string(err));
343 return (0);
344 }
345 err = kmod_get_info(kernel_port, (void *)&loaded_modules,
346 &loaded_count); /* never freed */
347 if (err) {
348 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: %s\n", __progname,
349 "kmod_get_info() failed",
350 mach_error_string(err));
351 return (0);
352 }
353 for (k = loaded_modules; k; k = k->next ? k+1 : 0)
354 if (!strcmp(k->name, kextname))
355 return (1);
356 return (0);
357}
358
359
360#define KEXTLOAD_COMMAND "/sbin/kextload"
361#define FS_KEXT_DIR "/System/Library/Extensions/smbfs.kext"
362#define FULL_KEXTNAME "com.apple.filesystems.smbfs"
363
364
365int
366loadsmbvfs()
367{
368 const char *kextargs[] = {KEXTLOAD_COMMAND, FS_KEXT_DIR, NULL};
369 int error = 0;
370
371 /*
372 * temporarily revert to root (required for kextload)
373 */
374 seteuid(eff_uid);
375 if (!kextisloaded(FULL_KEXTNAME)) {
376 error = safe_execv(kextargs);
377 if (!error)
378 error = !kextisloaded(FULL_KEXTNAME);
379 }
380 seteuid(real_uid); /* and back to real user */
381 return (error);
382}
383#endif /* APPLE */
